background_description: An odd birthmark, a strange smell: somehow, the touch of _elsewhere_ still lingers. You'll never fit in, at least not where you're at. Roll on the **Omens** table, but keep the results private for now.

Heirloom amulet.description: glows in the presence of magic

Stink Jar.description: Shattering this jar releases an odor so foul all nearby must make a STR save or immediately vomit.

Ivy Worm.description: Swallowed whole, it absorbs any toxins or rot in the body before exiting through the usual way.

Drowning Rod.description: A finger-sized wooden stick that doubles in size each time it is fully submerged in water. It does not shrink down again.

Rabbit's Foot.description: You were wearing it when they found you. They say it is the foot of she who left you, and that it protects you from witch magic.

starting_gear: Heirloom amulet (petty, glows in the presence of magic)

options.Description: An old hunter. You were both quite happy, until it all ended.
A wizened apothecary, who taught you the healing arts but maintained a clinical detachment.
A druid, who taught you the language of trees. When it came time to leave you took with you her staff.
The smith and his wife. When you were strong enough to wield a hammer, you took to the craft.
The local barracks where you were a mascot until you grew into chain mail.
A travelling troupe of actors. You never learnt their tricks, but you did learn to read from the many scripts and storybooks.

table2.question: What keeps bad tidings at bay?

options.Description: Your good luck charm. Conversations tend to flow more easily after a smoke.
Shattering this jar releases an odor so foul all nearby must make a STR save or immediately vomit.
A green worm often mistaken for a weed. Swallowed whole, it absorbs any toxins or rot in the body before exiting through the usual way.
A smooth blue stone that helps recall dreams more clearly. Overuse can cause dream-addiction.
A finger-sized wooden stick that doubles in size each time it is fully submerged in water. It does not shrink down again.
You were wearing it when they found you. They say it is the foot of she who left you, and that it protects you from witch magic.
